revised_title: Proton-Hydrogen Close-Capture Collision Spectroscopy: A New Approach
tldr: The authors present a new approach to study proton-hydrogen close-capture collision spectroscopy using an impact parameter perturbed-stationary-states treatment. They avoid spurious long-range couplings and enforce Galilean invariance by including momentum translation factors. The results show excellent agreement with experimental data and previous calculations, demonstrating the adaptability of the adiabatic representation even at high energies.
